intro: Ruschia acocksii, commonly known as the Cape sugarbush, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, cylindrical stems. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a valuable addition to xeriscaping efforts.
